title: Perth truck driver's ingenious arm rest hack goes viral online
text:
A truck driver's ingenious arm rest hack has sent social media into a frenzy.

The driver, who hails from Sterling in Perth, was captured resting his arm on a foam pool noodle he had cut to fit around his window frame.

The driver was praised after the image was shared to Reddit, with some asking where they could buy one.

The Perth truck driver was captured driving while resting his arm on a noodle he had cut to fit around his window frame

The driver was praised after the image was posted to Reddit with many asking where they could get one (pictured)

'Where can I buy one of these? Will it fit a 2014 BMW?' one Reddit user commented.

'And they say Aussie innovation is dead,' another wrote.

But not everyone was impressed, with some questioning whether the positioning of the makeshift device would be comfortable.

'OK someone help me out. How is driving with an arm on/out the window more comfortable than, idk, keeping that hand on the wheel?'

The driver even came under fire by one cautious Reddit user who said he could end up with skin cancer.

'That is a fast ticket to skin cancer. I'm not even joking. This is a direct cause of skin cancer, and the vast majority of people get them in older age on the driver's side arm, from doing exactly this.'
